args:
Now THIS is what I expect out of an eatery
with such a storied reputation! Truly we
are enjoying a taste sensation that befits
its long history and bold panache.
It certainly is delicious—but are you sure\nit is acceptable for you to treat me?
No need for hesitation; our dear young lad\nis simply flattering himself with a bit of\nself-importance.

And Pops here don't know when to zip it.
I only brought Pinon to this joint so I could
show my hardworking junior just how
much I appreciate her efforts.
From what I understand, you're kind\nof at the end of your rope with your\ninvestigation into that smuggling ring.
It's true that I lack for decisive evidence.\nNonetheless, you have my word that I\nshall see the matter resolved myself!
You're a reliable one, Pinon.\nJust don't burn yourself out, 'kay?
The wise know when to slow down—\njust like ol' Papa Bear here!
I'm of the impression you're ALWAYS\ntaking it slow... Hmm?
Blast! That's the man I'm looking for!\nWhat is he doing here?!

Ah, yes. Evidently there is a private room
for certain customers in the back of this
restaurant. It is often used for business
meetings or the like.
That could mean the smuggling ring!\nSorry, Nevin, but I have to go.
Dessert's on its way, though.\nMind if Papa Bear eats yours?
...Is this all right? You must have done a\ngood deal of work to get this information.
It's her case. I just gave her a little nudge.\nThis is as far as I go.
Always with the cool-cat act.\nStill, I was happy to hear what you said\nto her.
＂The wise know when to slow down.＂\nReflecting on that old case of yours?
Several years ago, in a North Grastaea chapel...
You have arrived. ...At last, I might add.\nState the reason for your coming later\nthan the appointed hour.
Forgive us, Sandalphon. The boy here was\nbehind on his reports, and it took some\ntime to sort them out.
I said I was sorry, Ramiel—and you can\nstop talking like you're my babysitter\naaany old time you want.
An odd request, considering that I am,\nin fact, your babysitter.
Or have you forgotten who it is that\nchanges your soiled bedsheets?
When I was a KID, maybe! Sheesh!\nLousy archangel...
Cease the murmuring and listen close.\nI will explain your mission now.
You have been tasked to search for and\nrecover a magical artifact that the\nChurch wishes to be sealed away.
Sealing something away is a serious step.\nWhatever IS this artifact?

It is called a gaolstone. It was originally
produced by a particular magical research
institute to aid cultivation and farming in
frigid regions.
It absorbs ambient mana and releases it\nas heat energy. Provided enough mana,\nit can produce the energy to melt steel.
Sounds like that thing'd fly right off the\nshelves, what with all the war going on\nup in the north.
This was the institute's concern as well,\nwhich is why they asked a neutral party\nto deal with it.

However, the Templar who was escorting
the artifact to church headquarters under
the pretext of it being a donation was
ambushed on a small mountain path.
The Templar is dead, and the stone's\ncurrent whereabouts unknown.
This thing's serious business.\nYou learn anything from the body?

Cause of death was a single stab wound
with a sharp blade. However, the body was
ravaged by fiends, so we cannot identify
the specific type of weapon.
However, the Templar was clutching this...
A halo necklace? Interesting. The band\nwas made with beads, and appears to\nhave been torn off.

It would be natural to assume this
belonged to the Templar, given its
importance as a symbol of the
Ilian Church.
If we allow the artifact to escape us,\nthe Church will lose face.
So I ask you to administer Her will\npromptly and quietly. Report back to me\nright away if you discover anything.
Another secretive task.\nWhat do you make of it?
She mentioned the Church losing face,\nwhich means our honorable commander\nsuspects what's really going on.
Someone from the Church stole the\ngaolstone, and the halo belongs to them.
And why would you think that, as opposed\nto the necklace belonging to the Templar?
Because it was ripped. Nobody tears their\nown necklace off to pray, no matter how\npious they're feeling.

And if the Templar bothered to grab that
necklace in his final moments when he
could have been fighting, he did so for
a very good reason...
Of course. By stealing the necklace,\nhe gives us a dying clue as to the\nidentity of his assailant.
Had that figured out already, did you?\nThen why'd you ask me?
As your surrogate parent, it's only natural\nfor me to measure your growth.
But you still have some ways to go;\nthere are yet more things that can be\nascertained from the evidence we have.
The beads used in the necklace are made\nfrom an ore than can only be mined in the\nsouthern part of the continent.
Yes. We are dealing not with someone\nfrom the northern Church, but the southern.

Well, that's a big piece of bad news.
The northern and southern churches might
believe in the same Ilia, but they're pretty
different organizations.
Yeah, this is a bit out of my wheelhouse.\nIf it got out that we were snooping around,\nwe'd be facing some serious backlash.
At worst, it could grow into a full-scale\nconflict between the two.
So all we have to do is track down a\nkiller from the southern Church without\nletting anyone catch on. Easy-peasy.
Do you wish to turn it down? I could ask\nSandalphon to give the task to another.
Are you joking? This is our mission now;\nif we walk, we'll never hear the end of it.
I am the apostle Nevin, one hand of the\nGoddess, and I shall see Her will done!
